resources.string: Grocery List for When You Shop
All Your Favorite Recipes In One Place
Tell us your food preferences and we will server you delicious recipes ideas
Take the grocery list from your cart to your nearest grocery store and buy the ingredients
Save time on planning by having your favorite recipes within reach
Save delicious recipes and get personalized content.
Welcome back! You are just a tap away from something delicious.

STEP 1
TO MAKE SUSHI ROLLS: Pat out some rice. Lay a nori sheet on the mat, shiny-side down. Dip your hands in the vinegared water, then pat handfuls of rice on top in a 1cm thick layer, leaving the furthest edge from you clear.r
r
STEP 2r
Spread over some Japanese mayonnaise. Use a spoon to spread out a thin layer of mayonnaise down the middle of the rice.
r
STEP 3r
Add the filling. Get your child to top the mayonnaise with a line of their favourite fillings – here we’ve used tuna and cucumber.

STEP 4r
Roll it up. Lift the edge of the mat over the rice, applying a little pressure to keep everything in a tight roll.r
r
STEP 5r
Stick down the sides like a stamp. When you get to the edge without any rice, brush with a little water and continue to roll into a tight roll.r
r
STEP 6r
Wrap in cling film. Remove the mat and roll tightly in cling film before a grown-up cuts the sushi into thick slices, then unravel the cling film.r
r
STEP 7r
TO MAKE PRESSED SUSHI: Layer over some smoked salmon. Line a loaf tin with cling film, then place a thin layer of smoked salmon inside on top of the cling film.r
r
STEP 8r
Cover with rice and press down. Press about 3cm of rice over the fish, fold the cling film over and press down as much as you can, using another tin if you have one.r
r
STEP 9r
Tip it out like a sandcastle. Turn block of sushi onto a chopping board. Get a grown-up to cut into fingers, then remove the cling film.r
r
STEP 10r
TO MAKE SUSHI BALLS: Choose your topping. Get a small square of cling film and place a topping, like half a prawn or a small piece of smoked salmon, on it. Use damp hands to roll walnut-sized balls of rice and place on the topping.r
r
STEP 11r
Make into tight balls. Bring the corners of the cling film together and tighten into balls by twisting it up, then unwrap and serve.
